New Records: Ravi Bishnoi ran through Zimbabwe's batting and finished with his career-best figures including a sensational 4-fer.
Key Match Events: India's batting lineup crumbled early, with wickets falling in quick succession.
Zimbabwe bowlers used the variations perfectly and didn't let any Indian batter be at ease.
Shubman Gill was the sole exception who appeared at ease up top.
Washington Sundar and Avesh Khan's stand brought back the hopes for India.
Blessing Muzarabani took a brilliant catch to dismiss Washington Sundar.
Tendai Chatara took a brilliant catch to dismiss Washington Sundar and seal the win for Zimbabwe.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and opted to bowl first.
IND's Playing XI included Shubman Gill, Ruturaj Gaikwad, Rinku Singh, Riyan Parag, Abhishek Sharma, Washington Sundar, Jitesh Sharma, Avesh Khan, Mukesh Kumar, Ravi Bishnoi, and Tushar Deshpande.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill said India bowled pretty well but let themselves down in the fielding department.
Shubman Gill added that halfway down the stage they lost half their side and reckons had he stayed in the middle for long, things could have been different.
Sikandar Raza, the Zimbabwean skipper, said he feels really happy about the win but need to take one game at a time.
Sikandar Raza added that they will enjoy this victory but the series is not over yet.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Zimbabwean bowlers used the variations perfectly and didn't let any Indian batter be at ease.
The pitch was sticky and there was turn on offer, which the Zimbabwean bowlers exploited.
The Zimbabwean team executed a near-perfect fightback and didn't let India go through.
